title: Redis AWS K8s (Opstree Operator) Flavour Configuration
description: Configuration schema for Redis deployment on AWS EKS using Opstree Redis Operator. Supports standalone, sentinel, and cluster modes with comprehensive K8s-native features.

deploymentMode.description: Redis deployment mode supported by Opstree operator. **standalone:** Single Redis instance (1 pod). **cluster:** Horizontal scaling with data sharding across multiple masters with replicas. **sentinel:** Master-replica topology with Sentinel for automatic failover. **Default: `standalone`**. **Production:** Use cluster for horizontal scaling, sentinel for HA with single dataset.

cluster.description: Redis Cluster mode configuration. Only applicable when deploymentMode is 'cluster'. Enables horizontal scaling with data sharding.

clusterSize.description: Number of master nodes in cluster. Each master handles a portion of the 16,384 hash slots. Minimum 3 required for cluster mode. **Default: `3`**. **Production:** Start with 3-5 masters; scale based on throughput needs.

replicasPerMaster.description: Number of replica nodes per master for high availability and read scaling. Total pods = clusterSize × (1 + replicasPerMaster). **Default: `1`**. **Production:** Use 1-2 replicas per master.

sentinel.description: Redis Sentinel mode configuration. Only applicable when deploymentMode is 'sentinel'. Provides automatic failover for master-replica topology.

replicationSize.description: Total size of replication group (1 master + N replicas). **Default: `3`** (1 master + 2 replicas). **Production:** Use 3 for HA.

sentinelSize.description: Number of Sentinel instances for monitoring and failover. Must be odd number >= 3 for proper quorum. **Default: `3`**. **Production:** Use 3 or 5; more than 5 rarely needed.

quorum.description: Number of Sentinels that must agree master is down before initiating failover. Should be majority (e.g., 2 for 3 sentinels, 3 for 5 sentinels). **Default: `2`**.

downAfterMilliseconds.description: Milliseconds before Sentinel marks an instance as down (SDOWN state). Lower values = faster failover but more false positives. **Default: `5000`** (5 seconds). **Production:** 5000-10000ms depending on network stability.

parallelSyncs.description: Number of replicas that can sync with new master in parallel during failover. Lower values reduce load on new master. **Default: `1`**. **Production:** Keep at 1 to avoid overwhelming new master.

failoverTimeout.description: Failover timeout in milliseconds. If failover isn't complete in this time, Sentinel retries. **Default: `10000`** (10 seconds).

image.description: Docker image repository (including registry) for Redis data pods (standalone, cluster, replication). If not set, defaults to `quay.io/opstree/redis`. You can point this to your own registry, e.g. `123456789012.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/redis`.

sentinelImage.description: Docker image repository (including registry) for Redis Sentinel pods. If not set, defaults to `quay.io/opstree/redis-sentinel`. You can point this to your own registry, e.g. `123456789012.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/redis-sentinel`.

resources.description: Kubernetes resource requests and limits for Redis pods. Applies to all Redis nodes (master/replicas in all modes).

requests.description: Minimum guaranteed resources. Used for pod scheduling decisions.

cpu.description: Minimum CPU guaranteed. Format: millicores (e.g., '500m') or cores (e.g., '1'). **Default: `500m`**. **Production:** Start with 1-2 cores; monitor CPU usage.

memory.description: Minimum memory guaranteed. Must accommodate dataset + overhead. **Default: `1Gi`**. **Production:** Size based on dataset; use 1.5× dataset size minimum.

limits.description: Maximum allowed resources. Pod will be throttled (CPU) or OOMKilled (memory) if exceeded.

cpu.description: Maximum CPU. **Default: `1000m`**. **Production:** Set 1.5-2× requests for burst capacity.

memory.description: Maximum memory. **Default: `2Gi`**. **Production:** Set 1.25-1.5× requests to prevent OOM.

storage.description: Persistent storage configuration using Kubernetes PVCs. Required for data durability.

storageClassName.description: Kubernetes StorageClass name. For AWS EKS, typically 'gp3', 'gp2', or 'io1'. **Default: `ebs-gp3`**. **Production:** Use gp3 for cost-effectiveness; io1/io2 for high IOPS workloads.

storageSize.description: Size of persistent volume per Redis pod. Must accommodate dataset + AOF/RDB files + growth. **Default: `10Gi`**. **Production:** Size for 2-3× current dataset for AOF growth.

nodeConfStorageSize.description: Size for cluster node configuration volume. Only used in cluster mode. Stores nodes.conf. **Default: `1Gi`**.

metrics.description: Prometheus metrics configuration via Redis Exporter sidecar.

enabled.description: Enable Redis Exporter sidecar for Prometheus metrics. Exports 100+ metrics on port 9121. **Default: `true`**. **Production:** Enable for observability.

redisExporterImage.description: Docker image (including registry/repository) for the Redis Exporter sidecar. Defaults to the public Opstree exporter image. Override this to point at your own registry mirror.

redisExporterTag.description: Docker image tag for the Redis Exporter sidecar. **Default: `v1.44.0`**.

exporterResources.description: Resource allocation for Redis Exporter sidecar container.

securityContext.description: Pod security context for running Redis containers with restricted privileges.

runAsNonRoot.description: Run Redis as non-root user. **Default: `true`**. **Production:** Always true for security.

runAsUser.description: UID to run Redis process. **Default: `1000`** (redis user in opstree image).

nodeSelector.description: Kubernetes node selector for constraining Redis pods to specific nodes. Example: {'disktype': 'ssd', 'nodegroup': 'redis'}. **Default: `{}`**.

tolerations.description: Pod tolerations for scheduling on tainted nodes. Use to dedicate nodes for Redis. **Default: `[]`**.

podDisruptionBudget.description: PodDisruptionBudget to limit voluntary disruptions during node maintenance.

minAvailable.description: Minimum pods that must remain available during disruptions. **Default: `1`**. **Production:** Set based on deployment size - for 3 nodes, minAvailable=2.

serviceAccount.description: Kubernetes ServiceAccount name for IRSA (IAM Roles for Service Accounts) or pod identity. **Default: `default`**. **Production:** Create dedicated service account with minimal permissions.

priorityClassName.description: PriorityClass name for pod scheduling priority. Higher priority pods are scheduled first during resource pressure. **Default: `""`** (no priority class).

imagePullPolicy.description: Image pull policy. **IfNotPresent:** pull if not cached (recommended). **Always:** always pull latest (slower). **Never:** never pull (only for testing). **Default: `IfNotPresent`**.
